title: How to Do Natural Pretty Makeup for School (Teen Girls)

steps.title: Lather up with lukewarm water and rinse off your skin thoroughly.
steps.content: Lather up with lukewarm water and rinse off your skin thoroughly. Makeup goes on best when your skin is clean and dry! Wash your face with lukewarm water and a gentle cleanser formulated for your skin type. Then, gently pat your face dry with a soft towel. [1] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Avoid harsh cleansers with alcohol in them since they can dry out your skin. If you have sensitive or acne-prone skin, stick with fragrance-free and non-comedogenic products. [2] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Hydration and protection are key, so use a product that gives you both!
steps.content: Hydration and protection are key, so use a product that gives you both! Moisturized skin is the perfect canvas for natural makeup. Choose an oil-free, non-comedogenic facial moisturizer and smooth a pea-sized amount all over your face. Give your skin about a minute to absorb the product. [3] X Research source Make sure the label says “broad-spectrum sunscreen” for full protection against the sun’s rays. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Dermatologists agree that moisturizer benefits all skin types, including oily skin. Just be sure to choose an oil-free product. [5] X Research source If you have acne, the sun can make it worse. Sunscreen will prevent that. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Stick with a lightweight foundation if you want to even out your skin tone.
steps.content: Stick with a lightweight foundation if you want to even out your skin tone. Heavy and full-coverage foundations tend to look unnatural and can make you break out, so stay away from those. [7] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Sheer/light coverage foundation, BB cream, and tinted moisturizer are all great options for a pretty, natural look. [8] X Research source Use your fingers or a foundation brush to smooth a thin layer of product all over your face, starting in the center and blending out to your cheeks, forehead, and chin. [9] X Research source Choose a product that matches your skin tone so it blends naturally. [10] X Research source Stick with liquid and cream formulas since they look more natural than powder foundations. If you’re using your fingers, don't forget to wash your hands first, especially if you have acne-prone skin. [11] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source You could also consider using a face primer before your foundation as it will help the make up last longer.

steps.title: A little concealer can disguise imperfections like pimples.
steps.content: A little concealer can disguise imperfections like pimples. Choose a concealer that matches your skin tone and use a fluffy eyeshadow brush to dab a small amount straight from the applicator on any dark spots or pimples you have. Then, buff around the spot lightly with a small makeup brush to blend the concealer out and you’re all set. [12] X Research source Too much concealer tends to look unnatural, so use it on problem areas only. You can also choose from a few different types of concealer, including liquid, stick, and cream products. Reader Poll: We asked 161 wikiHow readers about their preferred type of concealer and 53% of them agreed that liquid concealer works best for them. [Take Poll] So, you may want to try a liquid concealer first!

steps.title: Use a fluffy brush to lightly dust your face with powder if you have oily skin.
steps.content: Use a fluffy brush to lightly dust your face with powder if you have oily skin. Go with a setting powder that matches your skin tone or use a translucent powder. Use a fluffy kabuki brush to dust a little powder all over your face. This locks in your foundation and gets rid of any shiny areas. [13] X Research source You can skip powder if you don't have oily skin since light coverage foundation creates a great natural finish. Powders never look as natural as liquid/cream formulas on the skin. Use a powder puff if you want a more matte look. [14] X Expert Source Yuka Arora Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 30 August 2018.

steps.title: Cream blush formulas are easy to blend and look really natural.
steps.content: Cream blush formulas are easy to blend and look really natural. Choose a rose or peachy shade and use your fingertips or a blush brush to smooth the blush on the apples of your cheeks. Use circular motions to blend the blush out toward your hairline for a soft, healthy-looking flush. [15] X Research source To find the apples of your cheeks, look into a mirror and smile. The apples are the front parts of your cheeks that pop up under your eyes when you smile. Cream blush formulas look more natural than powder blush. Look for a blush shade that’s similar to the color of your cheeks after you exercise. [16] X Research source

steps.title: This makes your lashes look longer and opens up your eyes.
steps.content: This makes your lashes look longer and opens up your eyes. For a super subtle eye look, curl your lashes and skip the mascara completely. If you want to enhance your lashes a little more, apply 1-2 light coats of mascara to your top lashes only. [17] X Research source If you have blonde or red hair, stick with brown mascara since black will look a bit harsh and unnatural. If you have brown or black hair, go with black mascara. You could also use a clear mascara to give your lashes definition without adding colour.

steps.title: Use a brow product that closely matches your natural hair color.
steps.content: Use a brow product that closely matches your natural hair color. If your brows are a little patchy or super blonde, brow powder or pencil can give them more definition. Start by combing both brows up with a clean spoolie. Then, use light, feathery strokes to fill in any sparse areas with brow pencil or powder. Run a spoolie through each brow once more to blend the makeup. [18] X Research source Teenagers usually have thick, healthy brows, so you may not need to do this.

steps.title: Use a sheer rose or nude lip gloss for a hint of color.
steps.content: Use a sheer rose or nude lip gloss for a hint of color. Hydrated lips look amazing on their own, so a little balm might be all you need to complete your look. [19] X Research source To add a little shine, apply a clear or natural looking lip gloss . A natural-looking rose lip stain is a great way to add a little color without looking unnatural. [20] X Research source Avoid dark shades since they tend to look unnatural. Stay away from matte formulas, as well, since they're very drying.

steps.title: Sleeping in your makeup can cause breakouts and clogged pores.
steps.content: Sleeping in your makeup can cause breakouts and clogged pores. Always remove your makeup at night before you hit the sack! Just soak a cotton round with oil-free makeup remover and rub it gently all over your face to get off most of your makeup. Then, follow up with a gentle cleanser to wash away any leftover residue and dirt. [21] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source
